byline.contributor: Khalid Alokozay contributed reporting from Jalalabad, Afghanistan.

abstract: Over 33,000 undocumented Afghan refugees have been forced to return to their home country from Pakistan since start of 2015, more than in entire previous year; incidents of Afghans being intimidated or forced to leave are on rise since terrorist attack on a Peshawar school, which was claimed by Pakistani Taliban; it is unclear whether expulsions are due to official policy, which would be violation of international covenants on refugees.
lead_paragraph: Afghan refugees say they are being forced to return to their homeland after a terrorist attack on a school in Pakistan fueled a new wave of resentment against them.

headline.main: Refugees Are Pushed to Exits in Pakistan
headline.print_headline: Refugees Are Pushed to Exits in Pakistan

snippet: Afghan refugees say they are being forced to return to their homeland after a terrorist attack on a school in Pakistan fueled a new wave of resentment against them.
